name: Vote.org

founders.name: Debra Cleaver
founders.description: Founder Vote.org, VoteAmerica, ElectionDay.org, FuterVoter, and some other projects. Aggressively committed to increasing voter turnout. All around nice person.

You have the right to vote. If anyone tries to stop you, call or text the Election Protection Hotline at [1-866-687-8683](http://www.vote.org/<tel:1-866-687-8683>). Remember that democracy takes time. [Vote.org explains the process around verifying election results and how your vote is counted.](http://www.vote.org/</election-results/>)
Support Vote.org's crucial nonpartisan efforts to make voting more accessible for all Americans.
[Give Today](http://www.vote.org/<https:/secure.actblue.com/donate/homepopup?refcode=homepage-banner>)
# Everything You Need to Vote
### [Check Your RegistrationNot sure if you're registered to vote? We'll help you check and register if you can.](http://www.vote.org/</am-i-registered-to-vote/>)### [Register To VoteIt takes less than 2 minutes to register.](http://www.vote.org/</register-to-vote/>)### [Vote By MailCan't or don't want to vote in person on Election Day? Request an absentee ballot.](http://www.vote.org/</absentee-ballot/>)### [Get Election RemindersWe'll remind you when and what you need to vote, so that you never miss an election again.](http://www.vote.org/</election-reminders/>)### [Pledge To RegisterToo young to vote? Pledge to register and we'll text you a reminder on your 18th birthday.](http://www.vote.org/</pledge-to-register/>)
### Find everything you need to vote in our state election centers

## Looking to start your own voter engagement drive?
While Vote.org reaches voters directly through a multi-tiered approach, we also partner with key organizations, businesses, public figures and influencers to ensure that voters are receiving timely, accurate election information from the sources they already trust.
[Get Vote.org+ Tools](http://www.vote.org/<https:/www.tools.vote.org/>)
### Vote.org mission statement
Vote.org is the largest 501(c)(3) nonprofit, nonpartisan voting registration and get-out-the-vote (GOTV) technology platform in America. Our organization exists to remove the barriers that keep voters from making their voices heard at the ballot box.
[Learn More](http://www.vote.org/</about/>)
### Support Vote.org
Now more than ever, it's vital to invest in our democracy, and Vote.org has the tools, the reach, the partners, the scale and the trust that can return dividends on its investments. Your support will help Vote.org reach more voters. Every dollar counts.
[Donate](http://www.vote.org/</donate/>)
## Everything Vote.org does is in service of supporting democracy and expanding its promise.
But our democracy only succeeds if we can all take part in its care.
[Support Vote.org](http://www.vote.org/</donate/>)
### Free online tools
Add Vote.org's award-winning technology to your website and join a nationwide movement to increase voter turnout. Vote.org tools are here to simplify the entire process and ensure that your community is heard loud and clear in every election.
[Add Free Tools](http://www.vote.org/</technology/>)
### Vote.org+ Premium tools
For groups interested in supporter acquisition, measuring traffic, running your own GOTV program, or additional data collection, we also offer a paid premium suite of our tools, Vote.org+.
[Join Vote.org+](http://www.vote.org/<https:/tools.vote.org/>)
#### Follow us for the most up-to-date election & voting information
  * [Facebook](http://www.vote.org/<https:/www.facebook.com/votedotorg>)
  * [Instagram](http://www.vote.org/<https:/www.instagram.com/votedotorg>)

  * [YouTube](http://www.vote.org/<https:/www.youtube.com/@votedotorg>)
  * Email

generated_description:
### Vote.org: Empowering Democracy One Vote at a Time

Founded in 2008 and part of Y Combinator’s Batch S16, Vote.org operates out of San Francisco and is the largest nonpartisan voting registration and get-out-the-vote platform in the United States. Its mission? Simple: to remove the barriers that keep voters from making their voices heard at the ballot box.

#### What They Do
Vote.org offers a robust suite of online tools to help Americans with every aspect of the voting process — from checking registration status to understanding voter ID laws to tracking ballots. Their resources cater to various voter needs, including:

- **Voter Registration**: Check if you're registered and register in under two minutes.
- **Voting by Mail**: Request absentee ballots easily.
- **Election Reminders**: Get notified of important voting dates.
- **Polling Places**: Locate where to cast your vote.

At the heart of their approach is a commitment to accessible democracy for all, reflected in their various campaigns, such as the #VoteReady initiative and their Election Day efforts. 

#### Engage with Vote.org
They also encourage partnerships with organizations and influencers to amplify their message and ensure voters receive timely and accurate information. For groups interested in increasing voter engagement, Vote.org offers tools as part of its Vote.org+ suite, which includes premium features for campaigns aiming to mobilize communities and track voter engagement.

#### Support and Impact
As a registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit, Vote.org runs on the support of donations — every dollar contributes to empowering more voters. Their impact report showcases the positive outcomes of their initiatives, emphasizing why now, more than ever, everyone should invest in democracy.

#### Connect with Vote.org
Want to stay updated? Follow them on social media or join their newsletter for the latest in voting news and resources. 

Vote.org isn’t just a tool; it’s a movement to make sure your vote counts — because every voice matters in a democracy. 

For more information, head over to [Vote.org](http://www.vote.org).
